summary: I’m a fan of the idea that when Arya is getting particularly angry and aggressive about something, not something serious but...
body: I’m a fan of the idea that when Arya is getting particularly angry and aggressive about something, not something serious but she’s mad all the same, and she’s getting too riled up and she’s about to do something dumb gendry comes over and picks her up and carries her away. She can get out of it but she chooses not to because it makes her laugh melting her anger

She can get out of it but she chooses not to because it makes her laugh melting her anger

summary: I’m seeing all these “brilliant moments” from game of thrones(whether it’s focused on the entire show or just a particular...
body: I’m seeing all these “brilliant moments” from game of thrones(whether it’s focused on the entire show or just a particular season) and quite frankly I’m offended that i haven’t seen Arya killing Walder Frey/House Frey on there as well as Sansa killing/watching Ramsay getting eaten. Oh and The Knights of the Vale coming in past Sansa - that scene with her watching and then the view from above of the Knights smashing the Bolton’s army??? Beautiful.

reblog.comment: I’m seeing all these “brilliant moments” from game of thrones(whether it’s focused on the entire show or just a particular season) and quite frankly I’m offended that i haven’t seen Arya killing Walder Frey/House Frey on there as well as Sansa killing/watching Ramsay getting eaten. Oh and The Knights of the Vale coming in past Sansa - that scene with her watching and then the view from above of the Knights smashing the Bolton’s army??? Beautiful.

summary: Isn’t it funny how the people screaming Sansa and Arya getting along after last season is just so ooc happen to be the same...
body: Isn’t it funny how the people screaming Sansa and Arya getting along after last season is just so ooc happen to be the same people who said there wasn’t enough time for petty politics in the final season and that they all just needed to work together because there’s more important things to worry about

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

body:
Valar morghulis/ Valar Dohaeris

One of the many things that I love about Arya Stark’s storyline is the “Valar morghulis/Valar Dohaeris” quote. It’s so humbling and inclusive, isn’t it? All men must die, all men must serve - We know that death is an inevitable part of life and no one can escape it. It comes for the king of seven kingdoms as it comes for a simple beggarwoman. No one, no matter how rich, how wise or how beautiful can ever bribe off death. The king, the Hand, the soldiers, the handmaidens and the smallfolk are hence all same in the eyes of death.

I think the same can be said about “serving”. Each man has a duty and hence each man must serve. But the classist society of Westeros doesn’t understand that: I mean just as it is a farmer’s duty to cultivate fields, an armourer’s duty to make helms, an innkeeper’s duty to keep an inn, isn’t it also a lord’s duty to look after the wellfare of his people? Isn’t it a king’s duty to serve the whole of seven kingdoms? How is it then that the king doesn’t care about all the people that are starving? How is a lord doing his duty if he orders his soldiers to ransack villages and burn everything in their paths?

And that’s exactly what happened in the war of five kings. Each one of the kings wore a crown but they forgot to serve the ones who needed them the most: The smallfolks. Arya herself is a witness to this. You know people often say that Arya’s storyline is far removed from politics but what if she is learning the very basics of it? To serve and to see everyone as equal. After all if Westeros has to be rebuilt, it must be on a new principle. Otherwise it’s going to tear itself apart again and again.

I also find it odd when people say how Arya only represents death and not duty. In the books it is Arya who has served the most. She has hunted rabbits for her fellow travellers. She has done her duty to Yoren and has given him a proper burial. She has tried to keep her friends safe as much as she could. She has helped her father’s men to escape from Harrenhal and has given water to the dying soldeirs at the Stoney Sept. She has also avenged the rape and murder of the innkeeper’s daughter. Now tell me, are these not “serving”?

Death and Duty have always been an integral part of Arya’s storyline. I think even her father and mother’s house words reflect them. “Winter is coming” serves as a warning of harsh times. And as of now it literally signifies death too. The word ‘duty’ of “Family, Duty, Honour” can mean so many things: familial duty, the duty/service that one owes to one’s leige lord or the duty/service a monarch owes to the realm. Hence Valar Morghulis, Valar Dohaeris is an essential lesson that Arya learns throughout the series and when time comes I am sure that she will make use of the lesson of equality that has been imparted by it.

summary: Nixie’s MF Month: Day Two, Gendry x Arya - College AU.            I may not get to see you as often as I like. I may not get to...
caption:
Nixie’s MF Month: Day Two, Gendry x Arya - College AU. 

          I may not get to see you as often as I like. I may not get to hold you in my arms all through the night. But deep in my heart I truly know, you’re the one that I love and I can’t let you go.

Welcome to my ramblings! She, older than you, Down Under, blogging about all the things I like.  If you want to know more, go to links...
_______________________________

title: Sunday Six
body:
Arya followed. She didn’t have anything particular against her father’s ward, but after having heard Sansa’s greendreams of Theon and Ironborn invading Winterfell, she had looked at him with suspicion. Robb had been updated about Sansa and her newfound abilities, including that particular vision, but he had had a hard time believing it. He had accepted Sansa’s greendreams readily, having spent time with the crannogmen and knowing of their association with such old magic, but he adamantly denied that Theon could ever betray him.

Ned had admitted that it hadn’t happened yet and might never do, but had also advised Robb to keep an eye on Theon and keep him close – and whatever happened, not to send him back to Balon Greyjoy as Robb had suggested earlier. Robb had agreed and his friendship with Theon seemed to continue unimpeded.

trail.content:
Arya followed. She didn’t have anything particular against her father’s ward, but after having heard Sansa’s greendreams of Theon and Ironborn invading Winterfell, she had looked at him with suspicion. Robb had been updated about Sansa and her newfound abilities, including that particular vision, but he had had a hard time believing it. He had accepted Sansa’s greendreams readily, having spent time with the crannogmen and knowing of their association with such old magic, but he adamantly denied that Theon could ever betray him.

Ned had admitted that it hadn’t happened yet and might never do, but had also advised Robb to keep an eye on Theon and keep him close – and whatever happened, not to send him back to Balon Greyjoy as Robb had suggested earlier. Robb had agreed and his friendship with Theon seemed to continue unimpeded.

summary: What are your queer headcanons for the rest of the Starks?
question: What are your queer headcanons for the rest of the Starks?
answer:
Ned Stark is SO bi it hurts me. He and Robbert fucked in the sky cells when they were teenagers and wards of Jon Arryn. he’s also a bottom and cat totally pegs him but no one asked for that.

Robb is gay, he’s so so gay. I’ll ship him with just about anyone (who isn’t like...his brother you know, not here for that) but like, my favorite ship is him and an OC Byrant

Jon is gay and trans. 

Sansa is a lesbian and in love with Margaery Tyrell. 

Arya is nonbinary 

Bran and Rickon are….children and I don’t feel comfortable projecting things on to them? not that children aren’t queer, there totally are queer children but as a 22 year dude, that’s not something I’m comfortable with doing myself????

and then my most important queer stark headcanon
